avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger is low. Nevertheless danger spots are located ind very steep shady slopes. There spontaneous small sized wet-snow avalanches are possible.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Only little amount of snow, but spontaneous wet-snow avalanches from steep shady slopes are possible.

snowpackStructure.comment: The snowcover is isothermal and till high altitudes wet or moist. On southern exposed sloped the snow has almost fully retreated and the retreatment increases.

tendency.highlights: The Easter weekend will be sunny and mild in the mountains. The retreatment of the snowcover increases and the avalanche danger decreases.

weatherForecast.comment: On Friday the weather will be changeable and the summits will be cloudy with some rain showers which can be more intense south of the Alpenhauptkamm. The snowline is between 1.800 m in the Northwest and 2.000 m in the south and east. Moderate westerly winds. Temperatures in 2.000 m are between -1 und +2 degrees.

avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche danger is moderate  above 1.800 m. Danger spots are located in steep shady slopes. There spontaneous wet-snow avalanches are possible any time or can be triggered by an individual. On smooth surfaces gliding-snow avalanches are still possible. Avoid areas below glide cracks. Avalanches are small to medium sized.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Spontaneous wet-snow avalanches from steep terrain possible at any time!

snowpackStructure.comment: The snowcover is isothermal and till high altitudes wet or moist. On southern exposed sloped the snow has almost fully retreated and the retreatment increases.

tendency.highlights: The Easter weekend will be sunny and mild in the mountains. The retreatment of the snowcover increases and the avalanche danger decreases.

weatherForecast.comment: On Friday the weather will be changeable and the summits will be cloudy with some rain showers which can be more intense south of the Alpenhauptkamm. The snowline is between 1.800 m in the Northwest and 2.000 m in the south and east. Moderate westerly winds. Temperatures in 2.000 m are between -1 und +2 degrees.

customData.generalHeadline: Partially moderate avalanche danger due to wet-snow problem!
